job_title: Senior en Tecnologías de la Información y Comunicaciones
description:
En EY, tendrás la oportunidad de construir una carrera tan única como tú, con la escala global, el apoyo, la cultura inclusiva y la tecnología para convertirte en la mejor versión de ti. Y contamos con tu voz y perspectiva únicas para ayudar a EY a ser aún mejor. Únete a nosotros y construye una experiencia excepcional para ti, y un mundo laboral mejor para todos.

La oportunidad

Trabajarás con variedad de clientes para brindarles servicios profesionales y participarás en actividades de desarrollo del negocio. A cambio, puede esperar un aprendizaje y desarrollo de primera clase adaptado a sus intereses y motivaciones únicos. Tendrás todas las habilidades, conocimientos y oportunidades para progresar y estar listo para construir un mundo laboral mejor para nuestra gente, nuestros clientes y las comunidades que nos apoyan.

Tus principales responsabilidades
• Asegurar el funcionamiento correcto de la solución, dando soporte a problemas que salgan a diario.
• Ayudar al cliente en analizar, diagnosticar, replicar problemas hasta su solución.
• Mantener una comunicación constante con el cliente, comunicando avances y estatus en la solución de problemas.
• Ejecutar, dar soporte y mantenimiento a proyectos de tecnología después del periodo de transición, asegurando que fueron implementados de manera correcta.
• Cumplir con el SLA (service level agreement) establecido con el cliente,
• Dar seguimiento a incidentes
• Documentación de soluciones frecuentes
• Experiencia liderando equipos de soporte
• Llevar métricas de cumplimiento de incidentes, tiempo de resolución, complejidad y mejores prácticas de soporte
• Experiencia creando planes de soporte para distintos tipos de aplicaciones en distintas tecnologías.

Para poder optar al puesto debes tener

Formación: Licenciatura o Maestría en Ingeniería en Telecomunicaciones, Eléctrica, Electrónica o afines.

Certificación en Power BI

Experiencia:
• Mínimo 5 años de ejercicio profesional participando en equipos de gestión de proyectos. Conocimiento en diseño de red, incluyendo sistemas de seguridad de redes de telecomunicaciones, enrutamiento y planificación de redes de telecomunicaciones. Se deberá presentar título o certificación que lo acredite.
• 5 años de experiencia profesional en el desarrollo e implementación de bases de datos.
• 5 años de experiencia como administrador o líder técnico en dos proyectos de sistemas de información y redes de computadores.

Conocimiento de sistemas: Conocimientos en desarrollo de sistemas web: portales cautivos, administración de contenidos, gestión de usuarios, gestión de base de datos.

Habilidades Blandas:

Trabajo en equipo

Liderazgo

Lo que buscamos

Estamos buscando líderes que tengan una visión creativa y la confianza para convertir esa visión en realidad. Tendrás mucha autonomía en la ejecución de tus actividades, por lo que también deberás tener la habilidad de tomar la iniciativa y buscar oportunidades para mejorar nuestras relaciones y procesos actuales.

Lo que ofrecemos
• Aprendizaje continuo: Desarrollarás la mentalidad y las habilidades necesarias para afrontar lo que venga después.
• El éxito lo defines tú: Te proporcionaremos las herramientas y la flexibilidad para que puedas tener un impacto significativo, a tu manera.
• Liderazgo transformador: Te daremos las ideas, el entrenamiento y la confianza para ser el líder que el mundo necesita.
• Cultura diversa e inclusiva: Se le aceptará por lo que es y se le permitirá utilizar su voz para ayudar a otros a encontrar la suya.

Si puedes demostrar que cumples los criterios anteriores, ponte en contacto con nosotros lo antes posible.

La experiencia excepcional de EY. Es tuya para construirla.

EY | Construyendo un mundo laboral mejor

EY existe para construir un mundo laboral mejor, ayudando a crear valor a largo plazo para los clientes, las personas y la sociedad y a construir la confianza en los mercados de capitales.

Con la ayuda de los datos y la tecnología, diversos equipos de EY en más de 150 países proporcionan confianza a través de la garantía y ayudan a los clientes a crecer, transformarse y operar.

Trabajando en las áreas de aseguramiento, consultoría, derecho, estrategia, impuestos y transacciones, los equipos de EY plantean mejores preguntas para encontrar nuevas respuestas a los complejos problemas a los que se enfrenta el mundo actual.

Resumen

¿Es usted un modelador de datos sénior dinámico y visionario con el deseo de marcar la diferencia y ser un actor clave en la configuración de nuestro futuro del análisis de datos en la nube?

Buscamos que se una a nuestro equipo en crecimiento, donde dará rienda suelta a su innovación, pensamiento estratégico y destreza técnica para revolucionar la forma en que almacenamos, administramos y analizamos datos en la nube. Si prosperas en un entorno acelerado y en constante evolución y tienes una sed insaciable de tecnologías de vanguardia, ¡este puesto es para ti!

En NFI, ofrecemos soluciones innovadoras, integradas y personalizadas que abarcan toda la cadena de suministro. Cualquiera que sea el desafío de nuestros clientes, tenemos el conocimiento, la tecnología, la escala y el compromiso para ayudarlos a resolverlo. Es simplemente lo que hacemos.

Esta es una oportunidad para unirse a NFI en su viaje para convertirse en una organización basada en datos, continuar desarrollando su disciplina de análisis de datos e integrar las mejores prácticas en el entorno de datos. El modelador de datos senior desempeñará un papel crucial en el diseño, implementación y optimización de nuestros modelos y arquitectura de datos para respaldar la toma de decisiones basada en datos en toda la organización. Esta persona tendrá una sólida formación en modelado de datos, un profundo conocimiento de los principios del almacenamiento de datos y experiencia práctica con los servicios de datos de Microsoft Azure.

Responsabilidades
• Diseñe y desarrolle modelos de datos robustos, escalables y eficientes para diversas necesidades de análisis y procesamiento de datos.
• Colabore con ingenieros de datos, científicos de datos y partes interesadas del negocio para comprender los requisitos de datos y traducirlos en modelos de datos efectivos.
• Optimice y ajuste los modelos de datos para garantizar un alto rendimiento y escalabilidad.
• Implemente y administre soluciones de almacenamiento de datos en Microsoft Azure, aprovechando servicios como Azure SQL Database, Azure Data Lake, Azure Synapse Analytics y más.
• Realice análisis comerciales para comprender y documentar los procesos comerciales, los flujos de trabajo y las necesidades de información.
• Traducir los requisitos comerciales en requisitos de datos y especificaciones técnicas.
• Garantice la calidad e integridad de los datos a través de rigurosos procesos de prueba y validación.
• Desarrollar y mantener documentación completa para modelos de datos, esquemas y diagramas de flujo de datos.
• Colabore con analistas de negocios y otras partes interesadas para identificar oportunidades de mejoras e innovación basadas en datos.
• Manténgase actualizado con las últimas tendencias de la industria y las mejores prácticas en modelado de datos y servicios de datos de Azure.
• Asesorar y brindar orientación a modeladores de datos e ingenieros de datos junior.

Calificaciones
• Licenciatura o Maestría en Ciencias de la Computación, Sistemas de Información o un campo relacionado.
• Mínimo de 5 años de experiencia en modelado de datos, con al menos 2 años enfocados en Microsoft Azure.
• Dominio de herramientas de modelado de datos como ER/Studio, ERwin o similares.
• Gran conocimiento de las técnicas de modelado de datos relacionales, dimensionales y NoSQL.
• Experiencia práctica con conceptos de diseño de almacenamiento de datos de esquema en estrella de Kimble.
• Habilidades SQL de nivel experto y experiencia en ajuste y optimización del rendimiento.
• Experiencia con Azure SQL Database, Azure Data Lake, Azure Synapse Analytics y otros servicios de datos de Azure.
• Sólido conocimiento de los procesos ETL y herramientas de BI.
• Excelentes habilidades para la resolución de problemas y atención al detalle.
• Fuertes habilidades de comunicación, con la capacidad de transmitir conceptos de datos complejos a partes interesadas no técnicas.

Nos complace compartir que el rango de salario base para este puesto es $104,530.40 -$139,381.84. Este puesto también es elegible para una bonificación discrecional anual, cuyo objetivo es el 3%. NFI toma en consideración las calificaciones, la experiencia, la educación y la ubicación geográfica de los solicitantes al determinar una tasa de pago inicial.

Los empleados también son elegibles para un sólido programa de beneficios, que incluye cobertura médica, dental, oftalmológica, de medicamentos recetados, plan 401k, programa de bienestar, seguro de vida, tiempo libre remunerado y licencia parental remunerada, entre otras opciones de planes de beneficios.

Empleador que ofrece Igualdad de Oportunidades/Veteranos Protegidos/Individuos con Discapacidades

El contratista no despedirá ni discriminará de ninguna otra manera a los empleados o solicitantes porque hayan preguntado, discutido o revelado su propio salario o el salario de otro empleado o solicitante. Sin embargo, los empleados que tienen acceso a la información de compensación de otros empleados o solicitantes como parte de sus funciones laborales esenciales no pueden revelar el salario de otros empleados o solicitantes a personas que de otro modo no tendrían acceso a la información de compensación, a menos que la divulgación sea (a ) en respuesta a una queja o cargo formal, (b) en cumplimiento de una investigación, procedimiento, audiencia o acción, incluida una investigación realizada por el empleador, o (c) de conformidad con el deber legal del contratista de proporcionar información. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

UNICEF es el Fondo de Naciones Unidas para la Infancia que tiene como misión salvar, proteger e impulsar a los niños y niñas en todo el mundo. En UNICEF España trabajamos con pasión desde hace más de 60 años para promover y defender los derechos de los niños, niñas y adolescentes que viven en nuestro país, y recaudar fondos en apoyo a la infancia más vulnerable.

Se convoca el puesto de Analista de Aplicaciones - 365 en el Área de Tecnología de la Dirección de Tecnología, Integración de Datos e Innovación de UNICEF Comité Español.

Su misión consistirá en responsabilizarse de la administración, operación y soporte de las aplicaciones alojadas en la nube de Microsoft (Dynamics 365 Sales, Power platform), así como participar en la definición y puesta en marcha de nuevas funcionalidades dentro de las mismas, la definición de requisitos, implantación y pruebas, asegurando un correcto servicio, con el fin de contribuir al cumplimiento de los objetivos del Área de Tecnología, y con ello apoyar a la consecución de los objetivos globales de UNICEF Comité Español.
• Gestionar las distintas aplicaciones, principalmente MS Dynamics 365 (módulos de Sales, Customer Insights, Marketing), Business Central y entorno Azure de Microsoft (Azure Logic Apps, Azure Functions, Power Apps, Power Automate y Dataverso), con el fin de asegurar la correcta implantación, administración, operación, mantenimiento y soporte de estas de forma eficiente y proveyendo un servicio adecuado.
• Gestionar el desarrollo de los proyectos y servicios vinculados con aplicaciones corporativas de UNICEF, mediante el uso de metodologías ágiles (SCRUM y Kanban), trabajo con proveedores y uso de herramientas de colaboración y gestión de proyectos.
• Análisis de necesidades de las áreas, mantenimiento de backlog de producto y diseño técnico de soluciones para las aplicaciones corporativas de UNICEF y sus respectivas integraciones.
• Participar en la integración de los servicios de UNICEF Comité Español y las aplicaciones corporativas tanto internas como externas (web). Para ello se requieren conocimientos de bases de datos, ETLs, integración vía ficheros y desarrollo de APIs.
• Participar en la gestión del ciclo de vida de las aplicaciones, asegurando la calidad y el mínimo impacto de las nuevas implantaciones mediante el control de las versiones (TFS y Git), sus despliegues y el control de calidad y pruebas.
• Realizar la evaluación y reporte sobre los objetivos y / o actividades desarrolladas y elaborar informes e indicadores, con el fin de proporcionar el seguimiento de su actividad, impacto y retorno de la misma.
• Asesorar, prestar apoyo técnico, soporte, documentación y formación, de manera proactiva, para garantizar el desarrollo óptimo de los proyectos y actividades establecidos en el Plan Anual de Trabajo.
• Colaborar en la elaboración y seguimiento del Plan Anual de Trabajo del Área de Tecnología, aportando propuestas desde su visión, experiencia y conocimientos.

Requisitos Mínimos :
• Titulación universitaria o formación profesional (rama técnica, ingeniería, telecomunicaciones, informática o similar).
• Experiencia demostrada de al menos 5 años en posiciones similares, habiendo realizado funciones de configuración y administración de aplicaciones de MS Dynamics 365 (módulos de Sales, Customer Insights, Marketing), Business Central y entorno Azure de Microsoft (Azure Logic Apps, Azure Functions, Power Apps, Power Automate y Dataverso).
• Experiencia en monitorización del rendimiento de los flujos de trabajo (Azure Monitor), automatizaciones e integraciones (vía API REST o conectores estándar), asegurando su funcionamiento continuo y eficiente.
• Conocimiento y experiencia en lenguajes de programación y de bases de datos (desarrollo y consultas SQL).
• Experiencia en implantación de buenas prácticas en DevOps, CI / CD y control de versiones (Azure DevOps, Git, y TFS).
• Experiencia y conocimientos sobre la seguridad en plataformas Microsoft (integración con Azure AD, SSO, MFA, autenticación OAuth 2.0, equipos, roles y permisos), respuesta a incidentes, cumplimiento de auditorías y difusión de buenas prácticas).
• Conocimiento y experiencia en el trabajo bajo metodologías ágiles (SCRUM) y aplicaciones de gestión de soporte y tareas (JIRA).
• Habituado / a a trabajar en equipo en entornos de cambio tecnológico y en entornos profesionales con un elevado número de usuarios de diferentes perfiles, donde el entendimiento de los diferentes procesos de negocio es necesario para maximizar el valor de las soluciones tecnológicas entregadas.
• Idioma inglés (nivel mínimo requerido : intermedio B1).
• Capacidad para coordinar y gestionar a proveedores externos (servicios, integraciones, desarrollo, …).
• Buenas dotes de comunicación y capacidad didáctica.
• Capacidad para el trabajo en equipo, orientación al cliente y habilidades sociales.
• Alta orientación a resultados y capacidad de trabajo demostrando proactividad y autonomía.
• Actitud positiva y constructiva.
• Sensibilidad social e interés por las causas sociales, en especial por la infancia.
• Permiso de trabajo en España.
• Experiencia en consultoría tecnológica.
• Certificaciones (Microsoft, ITIL, …).
• Experiencia de trabajo remunerado / voluntario en organizaciones humanitarias.

TJX Companies

At TJX Companies, every day brings new opportunities for growth, exploration, and achievement. You’ll be part of our vibrant team that embraces diversity, fosters collaboration, and prioritizes your development. Whether you’re working in our four global Home Offices, Distribution Centers or Retail Stores—TJ Maxx, Marshalls, Homegoods, Homesense, Sierra, Winners, and TK Maxx, you’ll find abundant opportunities to learn, thrive, and make an impact. Come join our TJX family—a Fortune 100 company and the world’s leading off-price retailer.

Job Description:

Staff Product Manager

WHAT YOU’LL Do

We are looking for a Staff Product Manager to join our Global Finance Technology Organization, focused on the Procure to Pay value stream. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in driving value as a voice-of-the-customer, experience leading and developing successful products from ideation to launch, and ability to lead cross-functionality to deliver high-quality products that meet customer needs over the long-term.

Key REsponsibilities

A Staff Product Manager is responsible for defining and supporting the building of desirable, feasible, viable, and sustainable products that meet our customer needs over the product-market lifecycle. This role collaborates with a wide range of people to identify and define customer needs, understand the Solution Context, and develops the Program Vision, Roadmap, and Features required to meet these needs including assurance that business needs cascade down to the team level. A Staff PM owns the feature product backlog and serves as the ultimate product authority approving PI/TI and Iteration objectives.
• Responsible for ensuring that the Record-to-Report value stream creates feasible and sustainable products & solutions.
• Practice consultative partnership to analyze customer feedback to identify opportunities and prioritize product features.
• Collaboratively create a well-articulated global product vision, domain strategy, and long-range roadmap for the portfolio.
• Accountable for crafting and delivering the Product roadmap, partnering with Business Stakeholders, Architecture, and Engineering teams to ensure alignment to Business Strategies, Technical Roadmaps, and Architectural standards.
• Generates business value work with the portfolio layer, including experience in working with POs to ensure that work cascades to the team level.
• Track the success of products and identify areas for improvement.
• Mentor and develop a team of skilled and engaged product owners at various levels of seniority.
• Partners with companion teams for delivery of enterprise connected solutions.
• Accepts accountability for the end-to-end delivery of Epics, Features, Stories and/or Programs to achieve business outcomes.
• Evolve lean and agile process and operationalized product management workflows while leaving room for flexibility and team-specific ways of working.

What You’ll Need (Minimum Qualifications)
• Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent engineering skillset, training, or functional work experience
• 5+ years of experience as a Product owner
• Proven success working in a highly collaborative, matrix environment, with a track record of measurable business impact
• Outstanding communication, organizational, facilitation, negotiation, and mentorship skills
• Practiced consultative partnership with customers, with the ability to translate functional needs into requirements that drive value. Ability to develop & manage Lean Business Case, Epics and Features.
• Generate business value by collaborating with the Portfolio layer and PO to drive objectives at the team level
• Ability to create and maintain product roadmaps, while prioritizing program backlog and ensuring alignment between feature and team backlogs.
• Hands on experience participating in and leading SAFe events, such as sprint planning, release planning, and PI planning

Preferred Qualifications
• Product Owner / Product Manager (POPM) preferred
• Knowledge of Oracle EBS, Vertex, ReconNet, C2FO, OneSource, OneStream, IBM Planning Analytics, Itamlink, Lucernex, or other key financial applications
• Cloud experience (Azure, AWS)
• Experience with JIRA, Confluence, Aha, VSTS, or similar
Benefits include Associate discount; 401(k) match; medical/dental/vision; HSA; health care FSA; life insurance; short/long-term disability; paid holidays/vacation /sick/bereavement/parental leave; EAP; incentive programs for management; auto/home insurance discounts; tuition reimbursement; scholarship program; adoption/surrogacy assistance; smoking cessation; child care/cell phone discounts; pet/legal insurance; credit union; referral bonuses. All benefits are subject to applicable plan or program terms (including eligibility terms) and may change from time to time. Contact your TJX representative for more information.

In addition to our open door policy and supportive work environment, we also strive to provide a competitive salary and benefits package. TJX considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, gender identity and expression, marital or military status, or based on any individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state, or local law. TJX also provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities in accordance with the Americans with Disabilities Act and applicable state and local law.

divpLocation: Laurel, MD/p

pProperty: SouthRidge Apartments/p

pProperty Size: 386 units (market rate)/p

pEmployment Duration: Regular, Full-time/p

pSalary: $24-$25/hour + renewal bonus + benefits + housing discount + 401k matching/p

pAt a href="https://www.ticommunities.com/"strongTI Communities/strong/a, people are our most valuable asset. We are seeking individuals who want to create a better life for themselves and the residents we serve. TI Communities manages workforce housing in densely populated communities and provides enrichment programs for the residents of the communities./p

pAs an strongApartment Maintenance Technician,/strong you play a crucial role in ensuring the overall satisfaction and well-being of our residents. You will be responsible for performing a wide range of maintenance tasks related to apartment occupancy, building maintenance, move-ins, move-outs, unit turns, work orders, HVAC repair, plumbing, drywall, and providing exceptional customer service. Your technical expertise and dedication to quality workmanship will contribute to creating a comfortable and enjoyable living environment for our residents./p

p /p

pstrongWHAT WE OFFER:/strong/p

ul
liCompetitive pay, renewal bonus./li
liHousing discount./li
liMedical, Dental, and Vision insurance./li
li401k Match./li
li3 weeks paid time off./li
liCompany paid holidays./li
liTeam referral bonuses./li
liGood work-life balance./li
liOpportunity for growth/li
liCreate an autonomous, engaging, and rewarding environment where you will be valued./li
liReward and recognize your achievements and contributions./li
/ul

pstrongYOUR CONTRIBUTIONS:/strong/p

ul
liComplete work orders on a timely basis./li
liPerform preventative maintenance./li
liCheck, troubleshoot, and repair the following items: appliances, plumbing, carpentry, drywall, and electrical./li
liInspect the community on a regular basis and report any needs to the Service Director./li
liParticipate in all community maintenance duties, including: preventative maintenance, service request completion, and groundskeeping./li
liHandle emergencies that arise with appropriate communication and reporting follow-up./li
liConduct business in accordance with company policies, Fair Housing laws, Americans with Disabilities Act, Fair Credit Reporting Act, and all other laws pertaining to multifamily housing./li
/ul

pstrongSKILLS REQUIRED:/strong/p

ul
liExperience using equipment, supplies, and materials used in the maintenance field./li
liExcellent customer service and passion for helping people./li
liAbility to lift, push, and pull up to 90 pounds./li
liAttention to safety and the ability to comply with all MSDS Sheets./li
liGood communication and attention to detail./li
/ul

p /p

pTI Communities is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees./p

description:
We are seeking a highly skilled Superintendent to oversee construction projects, ensuring they are completed on time, within budget, and to high-quality standards. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in commercial, retail, and office space renovations, with a focus on tenant improvements. This role requires exceptional leadership and communication skills, as well as the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.

Key Responsibilities
• Oversee daily operations on construction sites to ensure safety and compliance with regulations.
• Coordinate and supervise construction workers and subcontractors to ensure quality standards are met.
• Develop and maintain project schedules, ensuring timely completion of tasks and milestones.
• Manage project budgets and expenditures, tracking costs and ensuring adherence to financial guidelines.
• Communicate effectively with clients, architects, and other stakeholders to provide updates and address any concerns.
• Conduct regular site inspections to monitor progress, quality, and adherence to plans and specifications.
• Resolve any issues that may arise during the construction process, ensuring minimal impact on project timelines.

Qualifications
• Proven experience as a Superintendent in construction projects, specifically in commercial and retail sectors.
• Strong knowledge of construction processes, safety regulations, and best practices.
• Experience in tenant improvement projects and office space renovations.
• Excellent leadership and team management skills.
• Strong problem-solving abilities and decision-making skills.
• Effective communication skills, both written and verbal.
• Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines.

Benefits

Vacation/PTO

Medical

Dental

Vision

401k

Bonus

Relocation

Email Your Resume In Word To

Looking forward to receiving your resume through our website and going over the position with you. Clicking apply is the best way to apply, but you may also:

rj.conner@cybercoders.com
• Please do NOT change the email subject line in any way. You must keep the JobID: linkedin : RC12-1855045 -- in the email subject line for your application to be considered.***

RJ Conner - Recruiter

For this position, you must be currently authorized to work in the United States without the need for sponsorship for a non-immigrant visa.

This job was first posted by CyberCoders on 06/02/2025 and applications will be accepted on an ongoing basis until the position is filled or closed.

CyberCoders is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, genetic information, registered domestic partner status, marital status, status as a crime victim, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. CyberCoders will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable state and local law, including but not limited to the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance, the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, and the California Fair Chance Act. CyberCoders is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with physical and mental disabilities. If you need special assistance or an accommodation while seeking employment, please contact a member of our Human Resources team to make arrangements.

description:
**Requirements**
• *KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES & COMPETENCIES**

- Read and speak English proficiently and interact with guests, associates and outside vendors.
- Understand and follow safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, procedure manuals, and company guidelines and standards.
- Write routine reports and correspondence.
- Add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals.
- Use units of measurement for weight, volume and distance.
- Apply good judgment at all times.
- Assist with resolving guest issues in accordance with company policies.
• *ENVIRONMENTAL JOB REQUIREMENTS**
- Regularly required to remain stationary, be mobile, navigate the hotel, handle, reach, and detect objects, tools, or controls, and detect scent and detect sounds.
- Position self to access low areas, traverse heights and remain stable while doing so, balance, and the ability to bend, kneel, or crouch.
- Occasionally push/pull objects (tools/carts/cleaning equipment) weighing up to 50 pounds.
- Discern or detect items in guest rooms to ensure safe performance of work.
- Frequently work in outside weather conditions (depending on hotel).
- Occasionally work in wet humid conditions (non-weather related), near moving mechanical parts, in the presence of fumes or airborne particles and toxic or caustic chemicals, and risk of electrical shock.
- Typically, moderate to loud noise levels in the work environment.
- The associate may be asked to travel to help additional sites within a reasonable geography.
• *MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS**
- High School Diploma or General Education Degree (GED); or one to three months related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.

ESA Management, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It is the policy of ESA Management, LLC to treat applicants and associates in all aspects of the employment relationship without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, pregnancy, age (as defined under applicable law), national origin or ancestry, disability status, veteran status, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.
• *Job Description**
• *POSITION PURPOSE AND SUMMARY**

The Maintenance Technician position must demonstrate and promote a strong commitment to providing the best possible experience for our guests and associates. The position is responsible for ensuring that all property equipment is functioning, premises are maintained in a pristine condition, and that all guest rooms are in good repair. The position is responsible for ensuring that all tasks outlined in the Green Shield Binder and as directed by the management team and/or Regional Asset Manager are completed in a timely fashion in accordance with company standards.
Watch **A Day in the Life** video for Maintenance Technician
• *MAJOR / KEY JOB DUTIES**
- Demonstrates and promotes a 100% commitment to providing the best possible experience for our guests and associates.
- Works with minimal supervision while performing all essential duties to satisfaction and within company standards.
- Responds to and assists with all guest requests with diligent follow-through in accordance with company guidelines and procedures.
- Performs the out of room cleaning outlined in the Green Shield Binder to ensure that the premises are maintained in pristine condition. This includes but is not limited to trash and debris, trash containers, cleanliness of building interior and exterior, grounds, walkways, stairwells, driveways and parking areas to include removal of snow/ice in walkways were applicable.
- Performs repairs listed on work orders and following the work order process as outlined in the Green Shield Binder. Repairs must be made in a timely fashion and professional manner.
- Completes preventative maintenance inspections and repairs as outlined in the Green Shield Binder.
- Follows the Green Shield Inspection schedule on a daily basis in order to accomplish all tasks outlined in a timely fashion in accordance with company standards.
- Maintains all records as outlined within the Green Shield Binder to include but not limited to Guest Room PM deficiencies, PM Room Inspections, Life Safety Inspections, Elevator Inspections and Non-Guest Room Deficiency Log.
- Follows the outlined workflow on the Green Shield Schedule, utilizes the SOPs as a reference guide to complete all tasks per company standards.
- Maintains organized and clean work area in the maintenance room, while managing and safeguarding all maintenance tool inventory daily. Ensures that all tools are in good working condition.
- Maintains clean and organized boiler rooms, electric rooms, HVAC rooms, fire sprinkler rooms, in accordance with company standards and local ordinances.
- Ensures that all fire safety equipment (fire alarm system, smoke detectors, CO detectors, fire extinguishers, etc.) are operational and that inspections are current and in compliance with company standards and local ordinances.
- Complies with all ESA safety and security policies and procedures to include OSHA and ADA.
- Where applicable to include maintenance of pool and or spa in accordance with ESA policies, procedures and in compliance with local ordinance.
- Handles or assists with the response to emergencies at the property or sister sites when asked by management.
- Monitors and follows up with outside vendors when directed by management.

.
• *OTHER DUTIES**
- Assists with cleaning any areas of the hotel as assigned by the manager when needed to include but not limited to font desk, associate breakroom, guest laundry, fitness room, vending areas, stairwells and common areas.
- Responsible for maintaining overall hotel cleanliness.
- Other duties as assigned by the management team.
• *BENEFITS**
- **Weekly Pay!**
- Competitive Wages
- Great working environment
- Employee Recognition Programs
- Medical Insurance
- Dental Insurance
- Vision Insurance
- Health Care and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts
- Employer Paid Basic Life and AD&D Insurance
- Employer Paid Long Term Disability
- Optional Employee Paid - Voluntary Benefits
- Short-Term Disability
- Buy-Up Long-Term Disability
- Supplemental Life Insurance
- Dependent Life Insurance
- 401(k) Savings Plan
- Paid Time Off
- Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
- Employee Perks Progam offering discounts to major companies
• *Compensation**
Pay Ranges
Pay range information for the position you are applying for is below.
Disclaimer: Compensation may vary based on role, level, experience, length of time in a position, and
location. Candidates are not guaranteed to be at the high or low end of the compensation ranges
presented. The Company complies with applicable federal, state, and local minimum wage requirements.

Pay ranges for the following states only:

California: $18.00 - $25.00
Colorado: $17.00 - $22.00
Illinois: $17.00 - $22.00
Minnesota: $17.00 - $22.00
New Jersey: $17.00 - $25.47
Washington: $18.50 - $25.00
Whitestone, NY: $20.97 - $22.32

description:
Change the world. Love your job.
Texas Instruments is looking for a skilled Equipment Technician to join our team. In this role, you will perform preventative maintenance, equipment repairs, equipment improvements, equipment upgrades, and equipment installation. You will interface and communicate with engineering and manufacturing groups across the fab to ensure all issues are solved appropriately and efficiently.

Responsibilities include:
• Improve system performance to achieve process requirements and eliminate repetitive downs
• Monitor and analyze all related data to improve and maintain tool performance and address all tool related issues
• Coordinate supplier service and repairs where needed
• Prepare the technical report and summary findings and recommending solutions to technical problems

description:
Join Our Consultant Network – Training & Development Consultant

TI Verbatim Consulting, Inc. (TIVC)

Location: Remote and/or On-Site (as needed)

Type: Independent Consultant (1099)

Compensation: Based on experience and engagement scope

Application Deadline: Rolling

About TIVC

TI Verbatim Consulting's (TIVC) mission is to "Help People Work Better Together." We believe that the workplace is more than just where humans fulfill their obligations – it is where personal and collective development takes place. Our solutions are focused on Human Enterprise Optimization through core competencies in Organizational Development, Training & Development, Strategic Communications, and Staffing Support Services. By aligning organizational culture with strategic objectives, we provide improved performance, productivity, and profitability for our Government and Commercial customers. At TIVC, people come first.

TIVC provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

As we grow, we are building our network of independent consultants to help deliver high-impact training programs to our government and private sector clients.

Opportunities in Training & Development

TIVC is actively seeking to expand our pool of qualified 1099 consultants with expertise in leadership and soft skills training. If you have experience in any of the roles or certifications listed below, we encourage you to submit your resume. You do not need to meet all qualifications—applicants with any relevant mix of skills are welcome.

We are especially interested in candidates with experience supporting training engagements for federal, state, and local government clients, as well as nonprofits and corporate partners.

We Are Seeking Independent Consultants With Experience In One or More of the Following Areas:

Training Roles
• Instructional Designers – Develop and revise engaging training content using adult learning and universal design principles.
• 508 Compliance Specialists – Remediate training materials to ensure full accessibility and compliance.
• Training Facilitators & Coaches – Lead live (virtual or in-person) training sessions; coach leaders and staff across organizations.
• Training Program Managers – Oversee the successful execution of training contracts, ensuring performance, compliance, and client satisfaction.
• Editors – Provide editorial support and quality assurance for training deliverables.
• Technical Facilitators – Support the technical delivery of virtual trainings; assist facilitators and participants to ensure seamless execution.
• Technical/Proposal Writers – Create compelling and compliant proposals and training solutions tailored to client needs.

Certifications & Areas of Expertise
• DiSC
• EQ-i 2.0
• ICF Coaching Certification (ACC, PCC, MCC)
• DOD Training Experience
• Federal Government Training
• State Government Training
• Corporate Training
• Nonprofit Training

How to Apply

To be considered for future consulting opportunities, please submit your resume along with a brief statement of interest outlining your relevant qualifications and areas of expertise. Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis as new projects and engagements arise.

We look forward to learning more about how you can help us help people work better together.

job_title: Associate Director, Government Relations (Washington) at Texas Instruments Washington DC
description:
Associate Director, Government Relations (Washington) job at Texas Instruments. Washington DC.

Change the world. Love your job.

The Texas Instruments (TI) Government Relations team represents the company on important public policy issues around the world. We work with state and federal government officials, legislators, trade associations, business partners, and internal and external stakeholders to advance a policy and regulatory environment that supports TI’s business priorities.

Texas Instruments is seeking a highly motivated individual to join our global government relations team. This role will spearhead efforts to advance TI’s position as a valued technology partner by developing and coordinating seamless working relationships with relevant government bodies, policymakers, regulatory agencies, and stakeholders. The evolving trade and regulatory environment within TI’s global manufacturing and business footprint will be a focus of the role. This is an opportunity to work with our regional GR teams and business units on a wide range of policies impacting the semiconductor industry in the U.S., China, and other key markets. A successful candidate will have excellent communication and interpersonal skills, policy experience, and ability to work in a DC-based and international team environment. This individual contributor role is based in Washington D.C. and will report to the Director of Government Relations, Global Policy & International Trade.

Roles and responsibilities:
• Cultivate and manage strategic relationships with key government officials, policymakers, and their advisors in the US and Asia.
• Monitor, analyze, and proactively communicate emerging policy and regulatory trends in the US and Asia impacting the semiconductor industry.
• Use engagement strategy to proactively identify, disseminate, and provide advice on political, policy and regulatory changes/practices.
• Prepare a variety of written communications such as reports, talking points, and factsheets.
• Represent TI at relevant conferences, industry events, and working groups. Identify relevant stakeholders to approach on policy topics and advocate TI’s position where appropriate.
• Partner with TI’s regional GR teams and cross functional stakeholders (i.e. communications, legal, product, regional sales) to respond to government consultations and develop positions to support the interests of TI.
• Maintain strong communications channels between relevant internal teams.
• Ensure compliance with company policies, regulatory, professional and legal requirements.
• Some domestic and occasional international travel required.

description:
TI’s legal department is seeking a talented Patent Attorney with a background in an area such as digital signal processors, microcontrollers, processor architecture, wireless communication circuitry, analog circuit design, and/or semiconductor device manufacturing. As a Patent Attorney at TI, you will immerse yourself in our cutting-edge technologies, developing a thorough understanding that will enable you to create inventive patent strategies.

Key Responsibilities:
• Conducting in-depth analysis of various technologies.
• Drafting and prosecuting patent applications in alignment with strategic goals.
• Collaborating with engineering teams to identify patentable inventions.
• Developing and maintaining a portfolio of patents in the designated area of expertise.
• Providing legal counsel on patent-related matters, including infringement and licensing.

Exciting Aspects of the Job:
• Technology Immersion: You will have the ability to cultivate a profound understanding of cutting-edge technology, fostering expertise in your chosen domain.
• Leadership of Patent Strategy: You will drive the development and execution of patent strategies, leveraging your expertise to develop comprehensive and interrelated approaches.

Why Join Us:

Unlike traditional patent roles, which offer a broad scope but limited depth, this position provides the opportunity for specialization and expertise development. You’ll have the chance to deeply engage with each patent within your portfolio, a rarity in the industry, fostering unparalleled growth and professional fulfillment. If you are passionate about semiconductor engineering and intellectual property law, and are seeking a role that offers both depth of understanding and a leadership role in shaping the field, we encourage you to apply and become an integral part of our dynamic team.

job_title: AI/ML Engineer - Smart Manufacturing and Automation
description:
Job Description

Change the world. Love your job.

Texas Instruments is seeking an innovative engineer who combines expertise in AI/ML with a passion for quality and manufacturing excellence. This role is crucial in driving our digital transformation initiatives through the development and implementation of AI-powered solutions. The position offers the opportunity to revolutionize our manufacturing processes using cutting-edge AI technologies while working closely with quality teams to enhance systems, tools, and customer relationships.

Responsibilities Include
• Develop and deploy AI/ML solutions to improve:
• Manufacturing quality and yield
• Process efficiency and automation
• Predictive maintenance capabilities
• Automated anomaly detection
• Create and maintain intelligent systems for:
• Data analysis and pattern recognition
• Real-time process monitoring
• Automated quality inspection
• Production optimization
• Lead integration of solutions with existing manufacturing systems
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement and scale solutions
• Provide technical guidance and training

Our ideal candidate would exhibit a growth mindset and enthusiasm for staying at the forefront of technological advancements while valuing open communication, teamwork, and a positive work culture.

Texas Instruments will not sponsor job applicants for visas or work authorization for this position.

Qualifications

Minimum Requirements:
• Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics or other related engineering degree
• 3 years’ experience working in Data Analysis / Data Science / Software Development
• Strong programming skills in Python, R, or similar languages

Preferred Qualifications
• Experience developing statistical methodologies, statistical data analysis or machine learning
• Experience with modern ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn)
• Experience in software development and automation
• Familiar with using modern AI for development
• Strong verbal and written communication skills
• Demonstrated strong analytical and problem solving skills
• Ability to work in teams and collaborate effectively with people in different functions
• Ability to take the initiative and drive for results
• Strong time management skills that enable on-time project delivery
• Ability to work effectively in an interrupt-driven, fast-paced and rapidly changing environment

About Us

Why TI?
• Engineer your future. We empower our employees to truly own their career and development. Come collaborate with some of the smartest people in the world to shape the future of electronics.
• We're different by design. Diverse backgrounds and perspectives are what push innovation forward and what make TI stronger. We value each and every voice, and look forward to hearing yours. Meet the people of TI
• Benefits that benefit you. We offer competitive pay and benefits designed to help you and your family live your best life. Your well-being is important to us.

About Texas Instruments

Texas Instruments Incorporated (Nasdaq: TXN) is a global semiconductor company that designs, manufactures and sells analog and embedded processing chips for markets such as industrial, automotive, personal electronics, communications equipment and enterprise systems. At our core, we have a passion to create a better world by making electronics more affordable through semiconductors. This passion is alive today as each generation of innovation builds upon the last to make our technology more reliable, more affordable and lower power, making it possible for semiconductors to go into electronics everywhere. Learn more at TI.com .

Texas Instruments is an equal opportunity employer and supports a diverse, inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, disability, genetic information, national origin, gender, gender identity and expression, age, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.

If you are interested in this position, please apply to this requisition.

About The Team

TI does not make recruiting or hiring decisions based on citizenship, immigration status or national origin. However, if TI determines that information access or export control restrictions based upon applicable laws and regulations would prohibit you from working in this position without first obtaining an export license, TI expressly reserves the right not to seek such a license for you and either offer you a different position that does not require an export license or decline to move forward with your employment.

description:
About The Job

Here's your chance to work as part of a dynamic and challenging engineering team on the latest semiconductor technology within the Advanced Technology Development (ATD) team.

The ATD Team Creates World-class Manufacturing Technologies By
• Developing new process platforms with step-function improvements in performance and cost
• Extending roadmap process technologies with new features, models and reduced costs
• Creating innovative, breakthrough technologies for new markets and new products

Responsibilities

Product Engineering & Memory group at Advanced Technology Development (ATD) is looking for Failure Analysis Technician to join FA & CA team. This role involves hands-on wafer level failure analysis to find a root cause of failures found during ATD development activities.

The main responsibilities include:
• Hands-on Operation of SEM and/or Dual-Beam FIB to have x-sectional analysis.
• Running Ion Milling Tool to make a large area x-section.
• Mechanical polishing/Delayering of wafer or package samples.
• Chemical etching/handling with a proper PPE.
• Assisting FA engineers with pre-handling FA samples.
• Taking Optical Images of samples.

The ideal candidate is expected to have a strong understanding of the following:
• Semiconductor Manufacturing/Process.
• Electron Microscopy.
• Metallurgical sample preparation.

job_title: Gerente de TI - M&T Bank Stadium
description:
Sector de impuestos

Puesto: Gerente de TI en el estadio M&T Bank

Rango salarial: 55 000$ - 75 000$

Las diferentes perspectivas nos hacen mejores. Nos comprometemos a crear un entorno de igualdad de oportunidades y trato justo, en el que aprender y crecer juntos sea solo una parte de nuestro día a día. Un entorno en el que puedes ser tú mismo de forma auténtica.

Acerca de Levy,
pionera en la definición de la experiencia hotelera deportiva y de entretenimiento, es reconocida como la empresa hotelera líder del mercado y más aclamada por la crítica de su sector. Nombrada dos veces como una de las 10 empresas deportivas más innovadoras por la revista Fast Company y una de las tres mejores empresas para la diversidad en Estados Unidos por Forbes, la diversa cartera de Levy incluye restaurantes galardonados; lugares deportivos y de entretenimiento icónicos, zoológicos e instituciones culturales, teatros y centros de convenciones; así como el Super Bowl, los premios Grammy, el US Open de Tenis Tournament, el Kentucky Derby y los All-Star Games de la NHL, la MLB, la NBA, la NFL y la MLS.
Resumen del trabajo

Resumen del trabajo:

Como gerente de TI, será responsable de supervisar el mantenimiento y el uso efectivo de todos los sistemas y recursos tecnológicos en la ubicación.

Responsabilidades principales:
• Supervisar el rendimiento de todas las aplicaciones y sistemas basados en TI en la ubicación
• Capacitar y apoyar a los equipos de administración en el uso y mantenimiento adecuados de los sistemas y aplicaciones
• Realizar un mantenimiento proactivo de los sistemas y la infraestructura de TI en la ubicación
• Actuar como el principal punto de contacto para los problemas o consultas de los usuarios
• Sirven como contacto principal para el soporte de sistemas y las consultas relacionadas con la TI dentro de su región
• Coordine la capacitación sobre sistemas y aplicaciones a través del equipo de TI del Ministerio del Interior con los proveedores o los recursos internos, según lo soliciten
• Siga de manera constante las prioridades de los servicios de TI para garantizar el mejor soporte y comunicación con sus ubicaciones, los equipos de soporte regionales y el Ministerio del Interior
• Proporcione soporte a los sistemas
• Coordine el soporte in situ para los eventos de ubicación según lo solicite
• Actúe como punto de escalamiento para el soporte de todos los sistemas relacionados con la TI
• Gestione los registros de problemas del sistema de ubicación
• Participa en llamadas programadas regularmente con el personal del Ministerio del Interior y los proveedores para revisar los problemas pendientes
• Comunique el progreso al personal local, regional y del Ministerio del Interior relevante, según sea necesario
• Mantenga los recuentos de inventario de todos los sistemas sobre el terreno por ubicación y oferta de servicios dentro de su región respectiva
• Haga un seguimiento con la administración regional y de ubicación a intervalos regulares para asegurarse de que los sistemas funcionen según lo esperado
• Asegúrese de que los sistemas y servidores cuenten con los parches adecuados, que utilicen una versión uniforme del software y que funcionen en un entorno estable en toda la región, con una periodicidad trimestral
• Transmite los requisitos de actualización/reemplazo del sistema y las solicitudes de desarrollo a nivel de ubicación al equipo de TI del Ministerio del Interior
• Ayuda en la planificación, coordinación y ejecución de las instalaciones y actualizaciones del sistema
• Comprenda y ejecute las prioridades técnicas, los estándares y los procedimientos para los sistemas actuales y futuros según las instrucciones
• Revisa y evalúa las nuevas ofertas de tecnología y sistemas en función de las necesidades empresariales actuales y futuras, y colabora con el departamento de TI del Ministerio del Interior para hacer recomendaciones para la implementación
• Desarrolle un conocimiento profundo y práctico de los productos y mantenga un análisis técnico y operativo de los puntos fuertes y débiles
• Proporcione soporte técnico y actúe como punto de escalamiento para el soporte de TI local (administradores de TI locales o supervisores o técnicos de TI que trabajan cada hora)
• Dirige y haz un seguimiento con los equipos de recursos de los proveedores, de soporte in situ o de personal local mientras trabajas en cualquier proyecto
• Otras tareas asignadas

Cualificaciones preferidas:
• Se prefiere una licenciatura o maestría en Ciencias de la Computación o un campo relacionado; o una combinación equivalente de educación y experiencia, habilidad equivalente
• Se prefiere un mínimo de 5 años de experiencia en el soporte de sistemas POS en el negocio de restaurantes y hostelería
• Habilidades básicas como redes, bases de datos y creación de scripts
• Sólidas habilidades de liderazgo demostradas
• Excelentes habilidades de comunicación verbal y escrita
• Capaz de trabajar de forma independiente sin una supervisión cercana
• Capaz de analizar cuestiones y problemas y conocer y seguir el plan de escalamiento
• Bien organizado, capaz de gestionar múltiples tareas al mismo tiempo
• Se prefiere tener experiencia con puntos de venta basados en la nube (Appetize, Bypass, VenueNext)
• Se prefiere tener experiencia en el cumplimiento de PCI

¿Sientes curiosidad por la vida en Levy? Échale un vistazo: Levy Culture

Levy es miembro de Compass Group USA. Compass Group/Levy es un empleador que ofrece igualdad de oportunidades. En Compass/Levy, nos comprometemos a tratar a todos los solicitantes y asociados de manera justa en función de sus habilidades, logros y experiencia sin distinción de raza, nacionalidad, sexo, edad, discapacidad, condición de veterano, orientación sexual, identidad de género o cualquier otra clasificación protegida por la ley.

Los candidatos calificados deben poder desempeñar las funciones esenciales de este puesto de manera satisfactoria, con o sin una adaptación razonable. Descargo de responsabilidad: este puesto de trabajo no es necesariamente una lista exhaustiva de todas las responsabilidades, habilidades, tareas o requisitos esenciales asociados con este puesto. Si bien esto pretende reflejar con precisión el puesto publicado, la Compañía se reserva el derecho de modificar o cambiar las funciones esenciales del puesto de trabajo en función de las necesidades empresariales.

Consideraremos para el empleo a todos los solicitantes que reúnan los requisitos, incluidos aquellos con antecedentes penales (incluidos los antecedentes de conducción pertinentes), de conformidad con todas las leyes federales, estatales y locales aplicables, incluida la Ordenanza sobre la Iniciativa de Oportunidades Justas para la Contratación de la Ciudad de Los Ángeles, la Ordenanza sobre Oportunidades Justas de San Francisco y la Ley de Oportunidades Justas de Nueva York. Alentamos a los solicitantes con antecedentes penales (y antecedentes de conducción) a que presenten su solicitud.

Las solicitudes se aceptan de forma continua.

En Levy, equipo = familia. Y siempre nos ocuparemos de la familia. Obtenga más información sobre los beneficios que ofrece Levy.
• Médico
• Odontológico
• Visión
• Seguro de vida/ AD
• Seguro de invalidez
• Plan de jubilación
• Plan de tiempo libre flexible
• Licencia parental remunerada
• Tiempo libre en vacaciones (varía según el sitio/estado)
• Permiso personal
• Programa de compras asociadas
• Programas de salud y bienestar
• Mercado de descuentos
• Protección contra el robo de identidad
• Seguro para mascotas
• Beneficios para viajeros
• Programa de asistencia al empleado
• Cuentas de gastos flexibles (FSA)

Levy mantiene un lugar de trabajo libre de drogas.

Los empleados también pueden ser elegibles para recibir beneficios por tiempo libre remunerado o no remunerado de acuerdo con las leyes federales, estatales y locales aplicables. Para trabajar en el estado de Washington o Maryland, o para trabajar de forma remota, haga clic aquí para obtener información sobre los beneficios por tiempo libre remunerado.

company: Confederated Tribes Of The Colville Reservation
description:
CLOSING DATE: Open Continuously

POSITION: Short Notice Home Living Assistant

SALARY: 20.00

REPORTS TO: Residential Manager

LOCATION: PSIS , Omak, WA

Basic Functions: The Home Living Assistant position requires healthy and functional home style role modeling, some meal preparation, housekeeping duties, chaperoning, and some recreation activities. The Home Living Assistant is responsible for providing safe and healthy living environment for residential students, assist with academic studies and instruction of basic life skills. The Home Living Assistant will be responsible for supervising students from the ages of 5-17 years.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

Education and Training:
• Typically requires an Associate’s Degree (preferred), and a minimum of 32 Semester Credits or 48 Quarter Credits or successfully passed PAXIS Test.
• Must be at least 21 years of age.
• Valid Washington State Driver license.
• Obtain First Aid/CPR Card in 30 days.
• Requires submitting transcripts/proof of degree/certifications and three written letters of reference upon applying.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
• Ensures residential students meet all scheduled mental health/IRG Counseling, recreation, academic and dormitory activities. They will also assist students in academic and life skill activities.
• Must maintain strict confidentiality and sign Paschal Sherman Indian School Confidentiality Oath Form.
• Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationship with supervisors and subordinates.
• Must be able to maintain professionalism and role model demeanor at all times.
• Monitors and reports on residential student compliance with scheduled activities; and on residential student behavior as provided by the residential program policies and procedures.
• Maintains clean dormitory areas and vehicles as provided for by the Residential Program.
• Works in coordination with teachers, parents, residential program staff and School Nurse.
• Attend all staff meetings and training activities.
• Maintains documentation in a daily log.
• Administers medication to residential students under direction of doctor or school nurse.
• Performs other duties as assigned.
• Must submit to a post-accident and reasonable suspicion drug testing.
• Must pass Washington State Patrol, Federal Bureau of Investigation and Colville Tribe criminal history background checks.

Note: Pursuant to Tribal Policy, if this position is safety sensitive it is subject to pre-employment drug testing. In addition, this position is subject to reasonable suspicion and post-accident drug testing.

TRIBAL MEMBER AND INDIAN PREFERENCE WILL APPLY; PREFERENCE WILL ALSO BE GIVEN TO HONORABLY DISCHARGED VETERANS WHO ARE MINIMALLY QUALIFIED.

If required of this position, you must possess and maintain a valid Washington State driver’s license and be eligible for the Tribes’ Vehicle Insurance. In addition, this position may be subject to pre-employment background clearances. If applicable, these clearances must be maintained throughout employment.

INFORMATION: Tanya Ives, HR Technician Senior, Confederated Tribes of the Colville Reservation, Human Resources Office, P.O. Box 150, Nespelem, WA 99155, (509) 634-2201 tanya.ives.HRS@colvilletribes.com

description:
Use our easy apply form to send your application to Jennifer Smith, the Jobot Pro hosting this job. Compensation Based on Experience.

Estimator-Commercial TI

$90000 - $140000 per year | Seattle, WA | On-Site | Permanent

Top ENR Gc looking to add an Estimator to their growing Team. Commercial TI Projects in the Puget Sound Region. Excellent opportunity for growth!

A bit about us:

Headquartered in Seattle, Washington, we have regional offices in Los Angeles, California and Portland, Oregon. We are a progressive West Coast commercial construction company known for our superior project management and field supervision, best-in-class standards, and excellent craftsmanship. Our expertise runs deep in pre-construction, project planning, and the timely and professional execution of the construction process in a variety market sectors including but not limited to retail, healthcare, non-profit, commercial office, mixed-use developments, exterior remediation, and seismic improvements. We have a complete understanding of the unique conditions and requirements of building in the West Coast and provide our team members with the training, resources and support they need to be successful. Our culture is shaped by a spirit of professionalism and teamwork. We are genuinely committed to playing an active role in helping our partners maximize resources, increase profitability and realize their vision. We are looking for Superintendents due to growth.

Why join us?

• Competitive Base Salary!
• Extremely Competitive Equity Package!
• Flexible Work Schedules!
• Accelerated Career Growth!

Job Details

Job Details:

We are seeking a dynamic and highly skilled Permanent Estimator-Commercial TI to join our growing team in the construction industry. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of commercial tenant improvements (TI) and a proven track record in the construction industry. This role will involve working on a variety of projects including occupied renovations, hospitals, offices, and clinical buildings. The successful candidate will be well-versed in using software tools such as Revit, WinEst, Beck Destini, and OST, and have experience in document control and managing subcontractor bids.

Responsibilities:

1. Prepare and coordinate full estimating packages for commercial TI projects, including occupied renovations, hospitals, offices, and clinical buildings.
2. Accurately forecast project costs and timelines, taking into account all relevant factors.
3. Utilize software tools such as Revit, WinEst, Beck Destini, and OST to create detailed estimates and reports.
4. Manage document control processes to ensure all documentation is accurate, up-to-date, and easily accessible.
5. Evaluate and manage subcontractor bids, ensuring they meet project specifications and budget requirements.
6. Collaborate with project managers, architects, and engineers to clarify scope of work and materials required for projects.
7. Continually monitor industry trends and advancements to stay current with market conditions and competitive pricing.

Qualifications:

1. Bachelor's degree in Construction Management, Civil Engineering, or a related field.
2. A minimum of 5 years of experience as an estimator in the construction industry, with a focus on commercial tenant improvements.
3. Proven experience with occupied renovations, hospitals, offices, and clinical buildings.
4. Proficiency in using software tools such as Revit, WinEst, Beck Destini, and OST.
5. Strong experience in document control and managing subcontractor bids.
6. Exceptional analytical and mathematical skills, with a keen attention to detail.
7. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.
8. Strong organizational skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet tight deadlines.
9. Knowledge of the latest industry trends and advancements.

This is an exciting opportunity to join a dynamic team and work on a variety of challenging projects. If you are a seasoned estimator with a passion for commercial TI, we would love to hear from you. Apply today!

Jobot is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We provide an inclusive work environment that celebrates diversity and all qualified candidates receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Sometimes Jobot is required to perform background checks with your authorization. Jobot will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with any applicable federal, state, or local law regarding criminal backgrounds, including but not limited to the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring and the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

description:
Use our easy apply form to send your application to Tony Marasco, the Jobot Pro hosting this job. Compensation Based on Experience.

Project Engineer

$70000 - $75000 per year | Newport Beach, CA | On-Site | Permanent

Commercial construction contractor is seeking Project Engineer with 1+ year TI construction experience

A bit about us:

As an established commercial contractor in the Southern California market, we have been supporting out clients with tenant improvement work for the last 20+ years. Whether it is office space upgrades, or technical infrastructure rework, our reliable and highly skilled team is able to provide fast and quality support.

Are you a Project Engineer with a Construction Management degree and 1+ year experience on commercial TI construction projects? If so, please continue to read as this role may be a fit for you!

Why join us?

20+ years in business
Commercial contractor
Ability to grow within the organization
Competitive pay

Job Details

Position Overview: We are currently seeking a dynamic and highly-skilled Project Engineer to join our fast-paced, innovative Construction company that focuses on commercial TI work. Our ideal candidate is someone who thrives in a challenging environment, is passionate about construction, and has a keen eye for detail. The Permanent Project Engineer will report directly to the Project Manager and will play a key role in ensuring the successful delivery of projects from conception to completion.

Day to Day Responsibilities:
• Assist in the planning and design phase of commercial tenant improvements projects, ensuring that all specifications and regulations are met
• Coordinate and oversee the work of the construction team and subcontractors, ensuring that all tasks are carried out according to plan
• Review and approve project drawings and specifications, making necessary changes when required
• Manage the procurement of materials and equipment, ensuring they are delivered on time and within budget
• Monitor the progress of the project, making sure that milestones are met and addressing any issues that arise
• Conduct quality control checks, ensuring that the work meets the required standards and that safety regulations are followed
• Prepare and present progress reports to stakeholders, providing them with updates on the project status and any challenges encountered
• Collaborate with architects, engineers, and other construction professionals, contributing to the overall success of the project

Required Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Construction Management, or a related field
• 1 years of experience as a Project Engineer in the Construction industry
• Commercial tenant improvement experience
• Strong knowledge of construction methods, materials, and regulations
• Excellent project management skills, with the ability to oversee multiple projects

Jobot is an Equal Opportunity Employer. description:
We’re looking for an experienced HVAC Project Manager to join our team and take the lead on tenant improvement projects. In this role, you'll be responsible for overseeing all phases of assigned projects—from kickoff to closeout—ensuring they are completed on time, within budget, and to the highest standards.

Success in this position means exceeding client expectations, fostering professional growth within the project team, and driving strong financial results for our employee-owned company.

If you thrive in a fast-paced environment, take pride in delivering quality work, and want to grow with a company that values ownership and excellence, we’d love to hear from you.

As a 100% employee-owned company (ESOP), we believe our people are our greatest asset. We succeed when our clients are satisfied, our teams are growing professionally, and our projects deliver strong financial results.

Responsibilities:
• Budgeting & Bidding via industry standards
• CAE estimating methodology mastery
• CAE systems, applications, and workflow mastery
• RFI creation management
• Billing & SOV’s
• Dynamically monitor manpower and crew rates with Field Operations
• Change Order estimating and management
• Bi-Weekly Project Manager Meetings
• Ongoing client base development
• Mentoring & training of Project Engineer Team
• Communication excellence with Field
• Lead mechanical conversations
• Job Walks & Site Visits
• Field & Foreman relationship development
• $3 – 5 million project load

Qualifications
• Strong experience in medical construction with HCAI compliance insight
• Demonstrated success managing complex projects
• Excellent communication and leadership skills
• Ability to lead mechanical scope discussions with clarity
• Proven ability to build team culture and deliver profitable projects

Benefits include the following:
• Medical, dental and vision benefits
• 401k retirement plan
• Life Insurance
• Long-Term Disability Insurance
• FSA & extra insurance
• Paid holidays
• Paid time off
• Employee stock ownership plan (ESOP)

Pay Range: $90k-$165k

Let’s be honest- life is too short to work at a job that you don’t love. So, do something about it! Come be a part of our team and work with us on industry defining projects. We are a family of passionate people, who are smart and kind, and have some pretty amazing skills. We love what we do, and love being California’s Homegrown Mechanical Experts.

A little bit about us. We have been in business for over 42 years, are a full mechanical contracting firm specializing in Major Construction, Tenant Improvement, Industrial, Plumbing, Retrofit, Service, Controls, Energy Commissioning and Detailing. Our divisions can handle a wide range of projects and services that include Design Build, Design Assist and Plan & Spec for facilities in the Medical, Entertainment, Laboratory, Hotel, Resort, Office, Government, Education, Civic and Commercial industries. Oh, we are also 100% employed owned (ESOP), have over 1,000 family members, and have one of the largest fabrication shops in California. Our corporate headquarters are in Southern California (Anaheim - just south of Los Angeles), conveniently located near several major freeways. We also have offices in San Diego and Hayward (Northern California). Our manufacturing facilities are located in Anaheim (Southern California) and Hayward (Northern California).

Please refer to our website at www.controlac.com for additional information.

We look forward to hearing from you!

description: POSITION PURPOSE AND SUMMARYThe Maintenance Technician position must demonstrate and promote a strong commitment to providing the best possible experience for our guests and associates. The position is responsible for ensuring that all property equipment is functioning, premises are maintained in a pristine condition, and that all guest rooms are in good repair. The position is responsible for ensuring that all tasks outlined in the Green Shield Binder and as directed by the management team and/or Regional Asset Manager are completed in a timely fashion in accordance with company standards. Watch A Day in the Life video for Maintenance Technician https://vimeo.com/showcase/5180017/video/291575214 MAJOR / KEY JOB DUTIESDemonstrates and promotes a 100% commitment to providing the best possible experience for our guests and associates. Works with minimal supervision while performing all essential duties to satisfaction and within company standards. Responds to and assists with all guest requests with diligent follow-through in accordance with company guidelines and procedures. Performs the out of room cleaning outlined in the Green Shield Binder to ensure that the premises are maintained in pristine condition. This includes but is not limited to trash and debris, trash containers, cleanliness of building interior and exterior, grounds, walkways, stairwells, driveways and parking areas to include removal of snow/ice in walkways were applicable. Performs repairs listed on work orders and following the work order process as outlined in the Green Shield Binder. Repairs must be made in a timely fashion and professional manner. Completes preventative maintenance inspections and repairs as outlined in the Green Shield Binder. Follows the Green Shield Inspection schedule on a daily basis in order to accomplish all tasks outlined in a timely fashion in accordance with company standards. Maintains all records as outlined within the Green Shield Binder to include but not limited to Guest Room PM deficiencies, PM Room Inspections, Life Safety Inspections, Elevator Inspections and Non-Guest Room Deficiency Log. Follows the outlined workflow on the Green Shield Schedule, utilizes the SOPs as a reference guide to complete all tasks per company standards. Maintains organized and clean work area in the maintenance room, while managing and safeguarding all maintenance tool inventory daily. Ensures that all tools are in good working condition. Maintains clean and organized boiler rooms, electric rooms, HVAC rooms, fire sprinkler rooms, in accordance with company standards and local ordinances. Ensures that all fire safety equipment (fire alarm system, smoke detectors, CO detectors, fire extinguishers, etc.) are operational and that inspections are current and in compliance with company standards and local ordinances. Complies with all ESA safety and security policies and procedures to include OSHA and ADA. Where applicable to include maintenance of pool and or spa in accordance with ESA policies, procedures and in compliance with local ordinance. Handles or assists with the response to emergencies at the property or sister sites when asked by management. Monitors and follows up with outside vendors when directed by management. OTHER DUTIESAssists with cleaning any areas of the hotel as assigned by the manager when needed to include but not limited to font desk, associate breakroom, guest laundry, fitness room, vending areas, stairwells and common areas. Responsible for maintaining overall hotel cleanliness. Other duties as assigned by the management team. BENEFITSWeekly Pay!Competitive WagesGreat working environmentEmployee Recognition ProgramsMedical InsuranceDental InsuranceVision InsuranceHealth Care and Dependent Care Flexible Spending AccountsEmployer Paid Basic Life and AD&D InsuranceEmployer Paid Long Term DisabilityOptional Employee Paid - Voluntary BenefitsShort-Term DisabilityBuy-Up Long-Term DisabilitySupplemental Life InsuranceDependent Life Insurance401(k) Savings PlanPaid Time OffEmployee Assistance Program (EAP)Employee Perks Progam offering discounts to major companiesCompensationPay RangesPay range information for the position you are applying for is below.Disclaimer: Compensation may vary based on role, level, experience, length of time in a position, and location. Candidates are not guaranteed to be at the high or low end of the compensation ranges presented. The Company complies with applicable federal, state, and local minimum wage requirements. Pay ranges for the following states only:California: $18.00 - $25.00Colorado: $17.00 - $22.00Illinois: $17.00 - $22.00Minnesota: $17.00 - $22.00New Jersey: $17.00 - $25.47Washington: $18.50 - $25.00Whitestone, NY: $20.97 - $22.32KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES & COMPETENCIESRead and speak English proficiently and interact with guests, associates and outside vendors. Understand and follow safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, procedure manuals, and company guidelines and standards. Write routine reports and correspondence. Add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Use units of measurement for weight, volume and distance. Apply good judgment at all times. Assist with resolving guest issues in accordance with company policies. ENVIRONMENTAL JOB REQUIREMENTS Regularly required to remain stationary, be mobile, navigate the hotel, handle, reach, and detect objects, tools, or controls, and detect scent and detect sounds. Position self to access low areas, traverse heights and remain stable while doing so, balance, and the ability to bend, kneel, or crouch. Occasionally push/pull objects (tools/carts/cleaning equipment) weighing up to 50 pounds. Discern or detect items in guest rooms to ensure safe performance of work. Frequently work in outside weather conditions (depending on hotel). Occasionally work in wet humid conditions (non-weather related), near moving mechanical parts, in the presence of fumes or airborne particles and toxic or caustic chemicals, and risk of electrical shock. Typically, moderate to loud noise levels in the work environment. The associate may be asked to travel to help additional sites within a reasonable geography. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONSHigh School Diploma or General Education Degree (GED); or one to three months related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.ESA Management, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It is the policy of ESA Management, LLC to treat applicants and associates in all aspects of the employment relationship without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, pregnancy, age (as defined under applicable law), national origin or ancestry, disability status, veteran status, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.
